Full Mechanism of Action (MOA): Inhibits platelet activation and aggregation by irreversibly binding to the P2Y12 class of ADP receptors on platelets.
Reversibly binds to the P2Y12 ADP receptor on platelets, inhibiting platelet activation and aggregation.
Inhibits cyclooxygenase-1 (COX-1) and cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2), reducing the formation of thromboxane A2 and inhibiting platelet aggregation.
Relaxes vascular smooth muscle by increasing nitric oxide, leading to vasodilation.
Selectively blocks binding of angiotensin II to AT1 receptor, preventing vasoconstriction and reducing aldosterone secretion; inhibits neprilysin to induce vasodilation and natriuresis.
Converts plasminogen to plasmin, leading to the degradation of fibrin in thrombi.
Converts plasminogen to plasmin, leading to the degradation of fibrin in thrombi.
